channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Everything Damaging To Democrats Is ‘Russian Disinformation’ To The Media
item.description: There’s a reliable pattern: Whenever something truly devastating to Democrats comes to light, the dying news media will immediately call it “Russian d...

item.title: Gaza Humanitarian Foundation Ex-Contractor Turns Whistleblower — and Blows Smoke
item.description: Anthony Aguilar’s extraordinary assertions about Israel lack even ordinary evidence.

item.title: ‘Sydney Sweeney Has Great Jeans’ Is An Admission That Woke Marketing Was A Mistake
item.description: The return of beauty and sex appeal to the fashion industry is a sign that nature is healing itself

item.title: Washington Times Weekly: The 'Rule of Five' in action
item.description: I'm George Gerbo and thanks for joining us for this edition of Washington Times Weekly, where we get the chance to sit down with our reporters and tal...

item.title: Is Trump ‘Rewriting’ the History of His Impeachments?
item.description: The idea that the Smithsonian Institution caved under pressure from the president’s appointees needs firmer evidence.

item.title: Senate session heads into overtime as Democrats stall votes on Trump nominees
item.description: The Senate is beginning to work into its scheduled summer break as a partisan dispute over quickly confirming President Trump's nominees derailed the ...

item.title: House panel agrees to delay Maxwell interview but won't grant immunity
item.description: House investigators agreed to delay interviewing Epstein associate Ghislaine Maxwell until after the Supreme Court reviews her conviction on sex traff...

item.title: Trump team derails Baltimore-D.C. high-speed plan
item.description: The Transportation Department said Friday it canceled grants for the "doomed" Baltimore-D.C. high-speed rail project.

item.title: A Halt to the Left’s Long March
item.description: From Harvard to the Los Angeles Times , the old quid pro quo is falling through.

item.title: Don’t Believe The Lies From NYT Russia Hoaxers About The Durham Annex
item.description: Russia hoax handmaiden Charlie Savage falsely claimed that the annex to the Durham report said something it never actually said.

item.title: We Don’t Need The Durham Annex To Know Hillary And The FBI Set Up Trump. We Watched It Happen
item.description: In fact, we didn’t need secret intelligence to expose the plan. It was playing out openly before our eyes in real time.

item.title: Ron Johnson Presses Pentagon On Reinstatement Of Troops Fired For Not Bowing To Biden’s Covid Shot Mandate

item.title: Corporation for Public Broadcasting starts shutting down
item.description: The Corporation for Public Broadcasting is shutting down after President Trump successfully rescinded funding for public broadcasting.

item.title: Baltimore Confronted Its Crime Problem by Abandoning Social Justice Platitudes
item.description: Idealism may come easier to academics, but reality-based strategies benefit the communities in need.

item.title: With Trump ‘Dug In’ on Tariffs, GOP Lawmakers Decide to Wait and See
item.description: ‘We’re clearly in uncharted waters,’ says Senator John Kennedy.
